intro: Androsace muscoidea, commonly known as the mossy androsace, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, surrounded by hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rocky slopes and forest floors. Its rhizomatous system allows it to spread and form extensive colonies in its natural habitat.
